editorialNotes.standard: Know the rules of poker? Get ready to break them in this brilliant roguelike deck-builder, which puts its own twist on the classic card game.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you make it through the night?

editorialNotes.standard: Ready for something a bit different? Plague Inc. challenges you to strategically spread and evolve diseases. While the concept isn't exactly honorable, the surprising ways all these novel gameplay systems interact make this twist on traditional heroism a lot of fun â€” even though it shouldnâ€™t be.
What happens after a zombie apocalypse? Find out by intuitively rebuilding civilization in this slick sequel to Plague Inc.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defense series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

Your starship is outgunned and on the run from a fleet of rebel forces; can you make it home alive? A space-combat experience of remarkable depth, FTL's elegant, interlocking gameplay systems generate moments of remarkable tension and reward. As your vessel leapfrogs between galaxies, youâ€™ll manage a crew, extinguish engine-room fires, target enemy shield generators with energy weapons, and equip powerful upgrades so you can plunge deeper into the uncharted cosmos. Itâ€™s a constant cycle of surprise and excitement, augmented by the gameâ€™s stylish presentation and irresistible charm.
Blanket the Pacific Northwest with wildlife, rivers, mountains, and forests in this mellow board game thatâ€™s fun solo or online.

Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains, and upgrading lines. Thereâ€™s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing subways come togetherâ€”and since no two games play alike, weâ€™re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

editorialNotes.standard: We love dropping into this city builderâ€™s immersive third-person view, which lets us stroll through bustling neighborhoods of our own creation.

editorialNotes.standard: While Hitman GO carved out a bold new direction for Agent 47, his next iOS mission expertly captures the riveting gameplay of the venerable console series. You wonâ€™t be donning disguises to sneak into enemy compounds (the gameâ€™s all about sniping), but you still carefully scout each location, unravel the intricately woven level design, and then strike with impeccable timingâ€”or die and try again. Hitman: Sniper does its legacy proud with 150 missions full of engrossing action and the seriesâ€™ quirky sense of humor.

editorialNotes.standard: Set in a snowy Nordic fantasy world, Bad North is about doing the best you can with what youâ€™ve got. Command troops of archers, swordsmen, and more as you protect a chain of islands from marauders, but one wrong move can prove costly. Tense, slick, and stylish, Bad North is a heady blend of tactical combat, strategic planning, and intuitive controls.

The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but thereâ€™s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

editorialNotes.standard: The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

If youâ€™re going to wage Total War, you better have a total strategy. Feralâ€™s faithful port takes us right back to the amazingly complex battles of Rome. We canâ€™t help but make alliances, purposely break them, then chase down our newfound enemies. Itâ€™s all fun and games, right? That is, until they get the upper handâ€¦

editorialNotes.standard: With its unique take on world domination, Sid Meierâ€™s Civilization has captured gamersâ€™ imaginations for more than 20 years. Civilization Revolution 2 carries the franchiseâ€™s winning formula to iPhone and iPad, expanding on its predecessor with a new arsenal of troops, technologies, and characters. Complex tactics and gorgeous 3D design make each match a pleasure as players expand their empire, make allies, and declare war using famous leaders ranging from Napoleon to JFK.
Customize decks between fights and purge cards to afford others in this roguelike deckbuilder that deftly shuffles genre expectations.

ios.subtitle: Build your own city as mayor!

editorialNotes.standard: The same thought popped into our head again and again while playing Banner Saga 2: Weâ€™re gonna remember this game. The gripping story. The thrilling turn-based battles. The heroes we lost in our struggle against the Dredge. Epic in every way, itâ€™s a beautiful and heart-rending adventure.

editorialNotes.standard: Building upon 2Kâ€™s tactical masterpiece XCOM: Enemy Unknown, Enemy Within adds a bevy of new features that fundamentally alter and improve the experience. With new abilities and mission parameters unlocked from the very first mission, Enemy Within injects tension and surprise into every corner. Fans of Enemy Unknown will find a wealth of new weapons, enemies, and maps that change the gameâ€™s flow, while new players will be enthralled as they fend off an alien invasion in intense, turn-based battles.
